- Can order and create with ANY stone, Lab Created or Genuine, but will affect pricing.
- Contact me for customization, requests and pricing.
NOTE: Due to this item being handmade, minor differences (from pictured) in color and texture will exist. I strive to keep them consistent, but minor variations do happen.
----- A Note on Lab Created Stones -----
This is NOT a simulated stone (aka red/clear glass)
- How they’re made:

The mineral composition of lab-created stones is created through a process similar to what nature does beneath the earth over millions of years, but in a lab at a fraction of the time, and for a fraction of the cost of mining.
The average person would be hard-pressed to tell the difference between a natural and lab-created stone. It takes a trained eye, high magnification and other instruments.

The main distinction is natural gems typically have inclusions from the crystallization process — gases and other minerals mixing during the molten stage of stone creation. Because lab-created stones rely on a steady, controlled process of applying minerals, heat and pressure, they usually have fewer inclusions.
So you get high-quality lab-created stones, and their prices are significantly lower than their natural gemstone counterparts.
- Other considerations:

In addition to getting a rare, top-quality fine gemstone look for less, many consumers are attracted to lab-created stones for other reasons. Environmentally speaking, lab-created stones do not tax natural resources the way the process for natural gems does — no mines are dug, the labs use a fraction of the utilities and resources necessary for a mining operation and leave behind less pollutants.

----- A Note on Lab Created Sapphires -----
This is NOT a simulated stone (aka clear glass)
- How they’re made:

The mineral composition of lab-created stones is created through a process similar to what nature does beneath the earth over millions of years, but in a lab at a fraction of the time, and for a fraction of the cost of mining.
The average person would be hard-pressed to tell the difference between a natural and lab-created stone. It takes a trained eye, high magnification and other instruments.

The main distinction is natural gems typically have inclusions from the crystallization process — gases and other minerals mixing during the molten stage of stone creation. Because lab-created stones rely on a steady, controlled process of applying minerals, heat and pressure, they usually have fewer inclusions.
So you get high-quality lab-created stones, and their prices are significantly lower than their natural gemstone counterparts.
- Other considerations:

In addition to getting a rare, top-quality fine gemstone look for less, many consumers are attracted to lab-created stones for other reasons. Environmentally speaking, lab-created stones do not tax natural resources the way the process for natural gems does — no mines are dug, the labs use a fraction of the utilities and resources necessary for a mining operation and leave behind less pollutants.

- 2mm Lab Created White Sapphire (Can be recreated with a different stone, Contact me for requests).
- Hung from simple, Sterling chain.
- Sterling Silver Cable Chain 2.0mm X 1.3mm With Spring Ring Clasp - 18" in length (Other lengths available at additional cost - Contact Me).
- Simple, minimalist.
NOTE: Due to the handmade nature of this item, minor differences in color and texture exist. I strive to keep them consistent, but minor variations do happen.
----- A Note on Lab Created Sapphires -----
This is NOT a simulated stone (aka clear glass)
- How they’re made:

The mineral composition of lab-created stones is created through a process similar to what nature does beneath the earth over millions of years, but in a lab at a fraction of the time, and for a fraction of the cost of mining.
The average person would be hard-pressed to tell the difference between a natural and lab-created stone. It takes a trained eye, high magnification and other instruments.

The main distinction is natural gems typically have inclusions from the crystallization process — gases and other minerals mixing during the molten stage of stone creation. Because lab-created stones rely on a steady, controlled process of applying minerals, heat and pressure, they usually have fewer inclusions.
So you get high-quality lab-created stones, and their prices are significantly lower than their natural gemstone counterparts.
- Other considerations:

In addition to getting a rare, top-quality fine gemstone look for less, many consumers are attracted to lab-created stones for other reasons. Environmentally speaking, lab-created stones do not tax natural resources the way the process for natural gems does — no mines are dug, the labs use a fraction of the utilities and resources necessary for a mining operation and leave behind less pollutants.

title: Sakura Cherry Blossom Pendant and Stud Earring Set
subtitle: Sterling Silver and Copper  •   Floral Earrings  •   Handmade
description: - Handmade Copper Sakura Cherry Blossom Pendant and Earrings with Argentium Silver ball / stud and Sterling Silver Branch.
- Simple, minimalist, everyday pendant/earring set.
- Flower Measures: 3/8" (9.5mm).
- Sterling Silver Cable Chain 2.0mm X 1.4mm With Spring Ring Clasp - Multiple Lengths.
- Comes with Sterling Silver ear nuts (Clear rubber available on request).
- Dainty and lightweight.

- Argentium silver is a brand of modern tarnish-resistant silver alloys, containing (in this case) 93.5% silver (Sterling Silver is 92.5%), a touch of germanium, and copper for strength. Argentium Silver presents a bright white color that is closer to fine silver than traditional sterling, and is less likely to tarnish under most conditions than Sterling Silver.
-These are uncoated and will tarnish over time, but can be cleaned easily if desired, though most love the beautiful patina copper develops.
NOTE: Due to this item being handmade, minor differences (from pictured) in color and texture will exist. I strive to keep them consistent, but minor variations do happen.
